short_text: This Surah is called Ad-Dahr as well as Al-Insan after the words occurring in the first verse.
text:
This Surah is called Ad-Dahr as well as Al-Insan after the words occurring in the first verse.

Period of Revelation

Most of the commentators, including Allama Zamakhshari, Imam Razi, Qadi, Baidawi, Allama Nizam ad-Din Nisaburi, Hafiz Ibn Kathir and many others, regard it as a Makki Surah, and, according to Allama Alusi, the same is the opinion of the majority of scholars. However, some commentators hold the view that the Surah was revealed at Madinah, and some others say that it was revealed at Makkah but vv. 8-10 of it were sent down at Madinah.

As far as the subject matter and the style of the Surah are concerned, these are very different from those of the Madani Surahs. A little study of it rather shown that it is not only a Makki Surah but it was revealed during the earliest period at Makkah, which began just after the revelation of the first seven verses of Surah Al-Muddaththir. As for vv. 8-10, they are so naturally set in the theme of the Surah that if they are read in their proper context, no one can say that the theme preceding and following them had been sent down 15 to 16 years earlier but these three verses which were revealed many years later were inserted here unnaturally.

In fact, the basis of the idea that this Surah; or some verses of it were revealed at Madinah, is a tradition which has related from Ibn Abbas (may Allah bless him). He says that once Hadrat Hasan and Husain fell ill The Holy Prophet and some of his Companions visited them. They wished Hadrat Ali to make a vow to Allah for the recovery of the two children. Thereupon, Hadrat Ali, Hadrat Fatimah and Fiddah their maid servant, vowed a fast of three days if Allah restored the children to health. The children recovered by the grace of Allah and the three of them began to fast as avowed. As there was nothing to eat in the house, Hadrat Ali borrowed three measures (sa') of barley from somebody (according to another tradition, earned through labor). When on the first day they sat down to eat after breaking the fast, a poor man came and begged for food. They gave all their food to him, drank water and retired to bed. The next day when they again sat down to eat after breaking the fast,
an orphan came and begged for something. They again gave away the whole food to him, drank water and went to bed. On the third day when they were just going to eat after breaking the fast, a captive came up and begged for food likewise. Again the whole food was given away to him. On the fourth day Hadrat Ali took both the children with him and went before the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace). The Holy Prophet (on whom be peace) seeing the weak condition of the three, returned with them to the house of Hadrat Fatimah and found her lying in a corner half dead with hunger. This moved him visibly. In the meantime the Angel Gabriel (peace be on him) came and said; "Look, Allah has congratulated you on the virtues of the people of your house!"When the Holy Prophet asked what it was, he recited this whole Surah in response. (According to Ibn Mahran's tradition, he recited it from verse 5 till the end. But the tradition which Ibn Marduyah has related from Ibn Abbas only says that the
verse Wa yut'imun-at ta'am... was sent down concerning Hadrat Ali and Hadrat Fatimah; there is no mention of this story in it). This whole story has been narrated by Ali bin Ahmad al-Wahidi in his Commentary of the Qur'an, entitled Al'Basit, and probably from the same it has been taken by Zamakhshari, Razi, Nisaburi and others.

In the first place, this tradition is very weak as regards its chain of transmission. Then, from the point of view of its subject matter also, it is strange that when a poor man, or an orphan, or a captive, comes to beg for food, he is given all the food. He could be given one member's food and the five of them could share the rest of it among themselves:Then this also is incredible that illustrious persons like Hadrat Ali and Hadrat Fatimah, who possessed perfect knowledge of Islam, should have regarded it as an act of virtue to keep the two children, who had just recovered their health and were still weak, hungry for three consecutive days. Moreover, in respect of the captives also, it has never been a practice under the Islamic government that they should be left to beg for food for themselves. For if they were prisoners of the government, the government itself was responsible to arrange food and clothing for them, and if they were in an individual's custody, he was made
responsible to feed and clothe them. Therefore, it was not possible that in Madinah a captive should have gone about begging food from door to door. However, overlooking the weaknesses of transmission and the probability of subject matter, even if the narrative is accepted as it goes, at the most what it shows is that when the people of the Holy Prophet's house acted righteously as they did, Gabriel came and gave him the good news that Allah had much appreciated their act of virtue, for they had acted precisely in the righteous way that Allah had commanded in these verses of Surah Ad-Dahr. This does not necessitate that these verses too were sent down on that very occasion. The same is the case with many traditions concerning the occasion of revelation. When about a certain verse it is said that it was sent down on a particular occasion, it in fact does not mean that the verse was sent down on the very occasion the incident took place. But it means that the verse applies precisely
and exactly to the incident. Imam Suyuti in Al-Itqan has quoted this from Hafiz Ibn Taimiyyah: "When the reporters say that a verse was sent down concerning a particular incident, it sometimes implies that the same incident (or matter) occasioned its revelation, and sometimes that the verse applies to the matter although it may not have occasioned its revelation."Further on he quotes Imam Badr ad-Din Zarkashi's view from his Al-Burhan fi Ulum al-Quran :"It is well known in respect of the Companions and their immediate successors that when one of them says that a verse was sent down concerning a particular matter, it means that the ruling contained in it applied to that matter and not that the matter itself occasioned the revelation of the verse. Thus, it only uses the ruling of the verse for the purpose of reasoning and not for stating a fact." (Al-Itqan fi Ulum al-Quran, vol. I, p. 31, Ed. 1929).

Theme and Subject Matter

The theme of this Surah is to inform man of his true position in the world and to tell him that if he understood his true position rightly and adopted the attitude of gratefulness, he would meet with such and such good end, and if he adopted the way of disbelief, he would meet with such and such evil ends In the longer Surahs of the Qur'an this same theme has been presented at length, but a special characteristic of the style of the earliest Surahs revealed at Makkah is that the subjects dealt with at length in the later period, "have been presented in a brief but highly effective way in this period in such concise, elegant sentences as may automatically be preserved in the memory of the hearers.

In this Surah, first of all man has been reminded that there was a time when he was nothing; then a humble beginning of him was made with a mixed drop of sperm and ovum of which even his mother was not aware; even she did not know that he had been conceived nor anyone else seeing the microscopic cell could say that it was a man, who in future would become the best of creation on the earth. After this, man has been warned, so as to say: "Beginning your creation in this way We have developed and shaped you into what you are today in order to test and try you in the world. That is why, unlike other creatures, you were made intelligent and sensible and were shown both the way of gratitude and the way of ingratitude clearly so that you may show, in the interval that you have been granted here for work, whether you have emerged as a grateful servant from the test or an unbelieving, Un- grateful wretch!"

Then, just in one sentence, it has been stated decisively what will be the fate to be met with in the Hereafter by those who emerged as unbelievers from this test.

After this, in vv. 5-22 continuously, the blessings with which those who do full justice to servitude in the world, will be favored, have been mentioned in full detail. In these verses, not only have their best rewards been mentioned but they have also been told briefly what are the acts on the basis of which they would become worthy of those rewards. Another special characteristic of the earliest Surahs revealed at Makkah is that besides introducing in them briefly the fundamental beliefs and concepts of Islam, here and there, those moral qualities and virtuous acts have been mentioned, which are praiseworthy according to Islam, and also those evils of deed and morality of which Islam strives to cleanse human life. And these two things have not been mentioned with a view to show what good or evil result is entailed by them in the transitory life of the world, but they have been mentioned only to point out what enduring results they will produce in the eternal and everlasting
life of the Hereafter, irrespective of whether an evil quality may prove useful or a good quality may prove harmful in the world.

This is the subject matter of the first section (vv. 1-22). In the second section, addressing the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace), three things have been stated: first, that "it is in fact We Ourself Who are revealing this Qur'an piecemeal to you, and this is intended to inform the disbelievers, not you, that the Qur'an is not being fabricated by Muhammad (upon whom be Allah's peace and blessings) but it is "We Who are revealing it, and it is Our Own wisdom which requires that We should reveal it piece by piece and not all at once."Second, the Holy Prophet has been told: "No matter how long ,it may take for the decree of your Lord to be enforced and no matter what afflictions may befall you in the meantime, in any case you should continue to perform your mission of Apostleship patiently, and not to yield to the pressure tactics of any of these wicked and unbelieving people."The third thing he has been told is: "Remember Allah day and night, perform the Prayer and spend your
nights in the worship of Allah, for it is these things which sustain and strengthen those who call to Allah in the face of iniquity and disbelief."

Then in one single sentence, the actual cause of the disbelievers wrong attitude has been stated: they have forgotten the Hereafter and are enamored of the world. In the second sentence, they have been warned to the effect: "You have not come into being by yourself: We have created you. You have not made these broad chests, and strong, sturdy hands and feet for yourselves, it is We Who made these for you; and it so lies in Our power to treat you as We please. We can distort your figures, We can destroy you and replace you by some other nation. We can cause you to die and can recreate you in whatever form We like."

In conclusion, it has been said: This is an Admonition: whoever wills may accept it and take a path to his Lord. But man's own will and desire is not everything in the world. No one's will and desire can be fulfilled unless Allah (also) so wills. And Allah's willing is not haphazard: whatever He wills, He wills it on the basis of His knowledge and wisdom. He admits into His mercy whomever He regards as worthy of His mercy on the basis of His knowledge and wisdom, and He has prepared a painful torment for those whom He finds unjust and wicked.
description: The surah that opens with a question posed to arrogant Man about his utter nothingness before God brought him into existence. It takes its name from the word “man” (al-insān) mentioned in verse 1. The surah speaks of how man is tested (verse 2 .) and what the results will be for the evildoers (verse 4) and for the righteous (verse 5 .). The Prophet is urged to persevere in his devotion and to bear with patience (verse 23 .).The surah is also known as: Every (Man).

Efendi Nahi.verse 76:1: Pa dyshim ka qenë kohë e gjatë (ajo), e që njeriu nuk është përmendur (nuk ka ekzistuar).
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:2: Me të vërtetë, Ne e kemi krijuar njeriun nga një farë e përzier (spermës); për ta provuar, dhe e bëmë atë që të dëgjojë dhe të shoh;
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:3: Na, ia treguam atij rrugën, e ai (do të jetë) ose mirënjohës ose jomirënjohës;
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:4: Na, me të vërtetë, për jobesimtarët kemi përgatitur zingjirë e pranga dhe flakë të zjarrit.
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:5: Sigurisht, të ndershmit besimtarë do të pinë nga kupa (në xhennet), pije të përbërë me kambor.
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:6: Nga burimi që vetëm adhuruesit e Perëndisë pinë, dhe të cilin mund ta çojnë (bartin) kah të duan;
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:7: ata (njerëz) që e zbatojnë premtimin dhe i druajnë Ditës, tmerri i së cilës përhapet gjithëkah,
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:8: dhe i ushqejnë të varfërit, bonjakët dhe të zënët robë (në luftë), madje edhe pse janë vetë nevojtarë për te (ushqim).
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:9: (Thonë ata): “Na, ju ushqejmë vetëm për hir të Zotit. Na – për këtë, nuk duam shpërblim as falenderim!
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:10: Na i druajmë Zotit tonë atë Ditë kur fytyrat janë të vrenjtura dhe të ashpra”.
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:11: Perëndia i ruan ata nga tmerret e asaj Dite; Ai atyre u jep shkëlqim (në fytyrat e tyre) dhe gëzim,
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:12: dhe, për durimin e tyre (në të drejtë), Ai i shpërblen ata me xhennet dhe (petka) të mëndafshta:
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:13: (ata) të mbështetur në kanape, nuk do ta ndjejnë as vapën (e Diellit) dhe as të ftohtit (e dimërit),
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:14: dhe do t’u jetë afër tyre hija e pemëve, frutet e të cilave do të mund t’i shfrytëzojnë (kapin) lehtë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:15: Do të shërbehen ata nga enët e argjendta dhe kupat (si shtamba) e tejdukshme,
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:16: të tejdukshme, nga argjendi, madhësinë e të cilave (do ta zgjedhin) sipas dëshirës.
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:17: Në të (xhennet) do të pinë shishe pijesh të përziera me Zenxhebil
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:18: nga burimi i xhennetit, (pija) e quajtur Selsebil.
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:19: Atyre do t’u shërbejnë djelmoshat (shërbyesit) përherë të rinj, - që, kur t’i shikosh, duken se janë margaritarë të shpërndarë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:20: Dhe, kahdo të shikosh (në xhennet), do të shohësh komoditet e begati të gjerë.
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:21: Ata do të janë të veshur me petka të holla mëndafshi të gjelbërt, dhe nga mëndafsi i trashë, të stolisur me bylyzykë të argjendtë, dhe do t’u jap Zoti i tyre të pinë pije të pastërta (të mrekullueshme).
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:22: (Ju thuhet atyre): “Ky është shpërblimi juaj; përpjekja juaj (në vepra të mira) është e falenderuar.
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:23: Me të vërtetë, Na ta kemi shpallur Kur’anin ty në intervale (kohë pas kohe),
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:24: Duro (prite) vendimin e Zotit tënd, e mos dëgjo as mëkatarët, as jobesimtarët!
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:25: Dhe, përmende emrin e Zotit tënd në mëngjes dhe në mbrëmje,
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:26: dhe, në një pjesë të natës kryej detyrat (falu) për Zotin, dhe falenderoje Atë natën, gjatë!
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:27: E, me të vërtetë, këta (jobesimtarët) e duan jetën e këtushme, e nuk e përfillin Ditën e vështirë (Kijametin) që do t’u vie.
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:28: Na i kemi krijuar ata dhe Na ua kemi dhënë forcën (e trupit të tyre).
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:29: Kjo, me të vërtetë, është këshillë, e kush të dojë, ndjekë rrugën që shpie te Zoti i tij, -
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:30: por ju nuk mund të duani, përveç nëse don Perëndia – se, Perëndia, me të vërtetë, është i Plotëdijshëm dhe i Gjithëdijshëm,
Efendi Nahi.verse 76:31: atë që don Ai, e shpie në mëshirën e Vet, e jobesimtarëve u ka përgatitur vuajtje të rënda.

null.verse 76:1: İnsanın elə bir dövrü olub keçmişdir ki, o, xatırlanmağa layiq bir şey olmamışdır! (Yaxud insanın elə bir dövrü olub keçmişdir ki, o həmin dövrdə xatırlanası bir şey olmasın?! Əlbəttə, olmuşdur. İnsan əvvəlcə mövcud deyildi. Sonra o, yə'ni ulu babamız Adəm torpaqdan və sudan yoğrulub insan şəklinə salınmış, ona ruh verilmiş və o, həyat sürməyə başlamışdır. İnsanın nə üçün yaradıldığını əvvəlcə nə göy əhli, nə də o özü bilirdi. Tədriclə mələklər və o özü nə üçün yaradıldığını anladı).
null.verse 76:2: Həqiqətən, Biz insanı (sonrakı mərhələdə ata-anasının toxumundan ibarət) qarışıq bir nütfədən yaratdıq. Biz onu (dünyada özünü necə aparacağı, hər şeyin xaliqi olan Allaha itaət edib-etməyəcəyi ilə) imtahana çəkəcəyik. Biz onu eşidən, görən yaratdıq.
null.verse 76:3: Biz ona haqq yolu göstərdik. İstər (ne'mətlərimizə) minnətdar olsun, istər nankor (bu onun öz işidir).
null.verse 76:4: Biz kafirlər üçün zəncirlər, qandallar və alovlu bir atəş hazırlamışıq.
null.verse 76:5: Şübhəsiz ki, yaxşı əməl və itaət sahibləri (Cənnətdə) kafur qatılmış (şərabla dolu) qədəhdən içəcəklər.
null.verse 76:6: O (kafur) elə bir çeşmədir ki, Allahın bəndələri ondan içəcək və onu (istədikləri yerə) asanlıqla axıdacaqlar.
null.verse 76:7: Onlar (Cənnətə nail olacaq müttəqilər) elə kimsələrdirlər ki, verdikləri sözü (etdikləri nəziri) yerinə yetirər və dəhşətli (aləmi) bürüyəcək (şəri hər tərəfə yayılacaq) gündən (qiyamət günündən) qoxarlar.
null.verse 76:8: Onlar öz iştahaları çəkdiyi (özləri yemək istədikləri) halda (və ya: Allah rizasını qazanmaq uğrunda) yeməyi yoxsula, yetimə və əsirə yedirərlər.
null.verse 76:9: (Və sonra da yedirtdikləri kimsələrə belə deyərlər: ) "Biz sizi ancaq Allah rizasından ötrü yedirdirik. Biz sizdən (bu ehsan müqabilində) nə bir mükafat, nə də bir təşəkkür istəyirik.
null.verse 76:10: Həqiqətən, biz Rəbbimizdən, çox sərt (müdhiş), cətin gündən (üzlərin dəhşətdən eybəcər kökə düşəcəyi, çöhrələrin tutulub qaralacağı qiyamət günündən) qorxuruq!"
null.verse 76:11: Allah da onları o günün şərindən qoruyacaq, onlara gözəllik və sevinc bəxş edəcəkdir (üzlərinə təravət verəcək, qəlblərini sevindirəcəkdir).
null.verse 76:12: Və onları etdikləri səbr müqabilində Cənnətlə və (geyəcəkləri) ipəklə mükafatlandıracaqdır.
null.verse 76:13: Onlar orada (o cənnətlərdə) taxtlara söykənəcək, orada nə günəş (qızmar isti), nə də sərt soyuq görəcəklər.
null.verse 76:14: (Cənnət ağaclarının) kölgələri üstlərinə düşəcək, meyvələri də onların ixtiyarında olacaqdır (istədikləri yerdə, istədikləri zaman onları dərib yeyə biləcəklər).
null.verse 76:15: (Cənnətdəki xidmətçilər) onların ətrafında gümüş qablar və büllur qədəhlərlə dolanacaqlar.
null.verse 76:16: Gümüşdən olan (çox şəffaf olduğu üçün bayırından içərisi görünən) elə billur (qədəhlərlə) ki, (xidmətçilər) onları (sahiblərinə) münasib ölçüdə etmişlər.
null.verse 76:17: Orada onlara zəncəfil qatılmış (zəncəfil dadı verən cənnət şərabı ilə dolu) badə də içirdiləcəkdir.
null.verse 76:18: (Zəncəfil) orada (Cənnətdə) bir çeşmədir ki, (suyu boğazdan çox rahat keçdiyi üçün) Səlsəbil adlanır.
null.verse 76:19: Onların dövrəsində həmişəcavan (xidmətçi) oğlanlar olacaqdır. Onları gördükdə, sanki (ətrafa) səpilmiş inci olduqlarını zənn edərsən.
null.verse 76:20: (Orada) hara baxsan, ne'mət və böyük bir mülk görərsən.
null.verse 76:21: (Cənnət əhlinin) əyinlərində taftadan və atlazdan (nazik və qalın ipəkdən) yaşıl libaslar olacaq, onlara gümüşdən bilərziklər taxılacaqdır. Rəbbi onlara çox pak bir şərab içirdəcəkdir.
null.verse 76:22: (Onlara belə deyiləcəkdir: ) "Bu sizin (dünyada etdiyiniz yaxşı əməllərə görə) mükafatınızdır. Zəhmətiniz (Allah yanında) məqbuldur (təqdirəlayiqdir)!"
null.verse 76:23: (Ya Peyğəmbər!) Həqiqətən, Biz Qur'anı sənə tədriclə (ayə-ayə, surə-surə) nazil etdik.
null.verse 76:24: Elə isə Rəbbinin hökmünə səbr et və onlardan (Məkkə müşriklərindən) günahkar və nankor olana boyun əymə!
null.verse 76:25: Səhər-axşam Rəbbinin adını zikr et! (Səhər, günorta və ikindi namazlarını qıl!)
null.verse 76:26: Gecənin bir qismində Ona səcdə et (axşam, gecə namazlarını qıl) və gecə uzunu da Onu təqdis edib şə'ninə tə'riflər de! (Təhəccüd namazını qılıb gecəni ibadət içində keçir!)
null.verse 76:27: Həqiqətən, bunlar (Məkkə müşrikləri) tez keçib gedəni (fani dünyanı) sevər, ağır günə (qiyamət gününə) dal çevirərlər.
null.verse 76:28: Onları yaradan da, güclü-qüvvətli edən də (oynaqlarını bir-birinə bağlayan da) Bizik. Əgər istəsək, onları özləri kimilərlə əvəz edərik.
null.verse 76:29: Həqiqətən, bu (surə) bir öyüd-nəsihətdir. Kim istəsə, Rəbbinə tərəf bir yol tutar (ibadət və itaətlə Allaha yaxınlaşar).
null.verse 76:30: (Ey insanlar! Onu da bilin ki) Allah istəməsə, siz (bunu) istəyə bilməzsiniz. (Ancaq Allah istəsə, istəyə bilərsiniz). Həqiqətən, Allah (hər şeyi) biləndir, hikmət sahibidir!
null.verse 76:31: (Allah) istədiyi kimsən ?z mərhəmətinə qovuşdurar. Zalımlara gəldikdə isə, (Allah) onlar üçün (axirətdə) şiddətli bir əzab hazırlamışdır!

null.verse 76:1: Zar je to davno bilo kad čovjek nije bio spomena vrijedan?
null.verse 76:2: Mi čovjeka od smjese sjemena stvaramo da bismo ga na kušnju stavili i činimo da on čuje i vidi;
null.verse 76:3: Mi mu na Pravi put ukazujemo, a njegovo je da li će zahvalan ili nezahvalan biti;
null.verse 76:4: Mi smo za nevjernike okove i sindžire i oganj razbuktali pripremili.
null.verse 76:5: Čestiti će iz pehara piti kamforom začinjeno piće
null.verse 76:6: sa izvora iz kojeg će samo Allahovi štićenici piti, i koji će kuda hoće bez muke razvoditi.
null.verse 76:7: Oni su zavjet ispunjavali plašeći se Dana čija će kob svuda prisutna biti,
null.verse 76:8: i hranu su davali - mada su je i sami željeli - siromahu i siročetu i sužnju.
null.verse 76:9: Mi vas samo za Allahovu ljubav hranimo, od vas ni priznanja ni zahvalnosti ne tražimo!
null.verse 76:10: Mi se Gospodara našeg bojimo, onog Dana kada će lica smrknuta i namrgođena biti."
null.verse 76:11: I njih će Allah strahote toga Dana sačuvati i blaženstvo i radost im darovati
null.verse 76:12: i Džennetom i svilom ih za ono što su trpjeli nagraditi:
null.verse 76:13: naslonjeni na divanima, oni u njemu ni mraz ni žegu neće osjetiti,
null.verse 76:14: i blizu će im hladovina njegova biti, a plodovi njegovi će im na dohvat ruke stajati.
null.verse 76:15: Služiće ih iz srebrenih posuda i čaša prozirnih,
null.verse 76:16: prozirnih, od srebra, čiju će veličinu prema željama njihovim odrediti.
null.verse 76:17: U njemu će iz čaše piće inbirom
null.verse 76:18: sa izvora u Džennetu, koji će se Selsebil zvati.
null.verse 76:19: Služiće ih vječno mlada posluga - da ih vidiš, pomislio bi da su biser prosuti.
null.verse 76:20: I kud god pogledaš, vidjećeš udobnost i carstvo prostrano.
null.verse 76:21: Na njima će biti odijela od tanke zelene svile, i od teške svile, nakićeni narukvicama od srebra, i daće im Gospodar njihov da piju čisto piće.
null.verse 76:22: To vam je nagrada; vaš trud je dostojan blagodarnosti!
null.verse 76:23: Od vremena do vremena Mi objavljujemo Kur’an tebi,
null.verse 76:24: zato izdrži do odluke Gospodara tvoga, i ne slušaj ni grješnika ni nevjernika njihova!
null.verse 76:25: I spominji ime Gospodara svoga ujutro i predvečer,
null.verse 76:26: i u jednom dijelu noći radi njega molitvu obavljaj, i dugo ga noću hvali?
null.verse 76:27: A ovi, oni život na ovom svijetu vole doista, a ništa ih se ne tiče Dan tegobni, koji ih čeka.
null.verse 76:28: Mi ih stvaramo i zglobove im vezujemo, a ako htjednemo, zamijenićemo ih njima sličnim.
null.verse 76:29: Ovo je pouka, pa ko hoće držaće se puta koji Gospodaru njegovu vodi -
null.verse 76:30: a vi ćete htjeti samo ono što Allah hoće - Allah, uistinu, sve zna i mudar je,
null.verse 76:31: On koga hoće uvodi u milost Svoju, a nevjernicima je pripremio tešku patnju.

null.verse 76:1: মানুষের উপর এমন কিছু সময় অতিবাহিত হয়েছে যখন সে উল্লেখযোগ্য কিছু ছিল না।
null.verse 76:2: আমি মানুষকে সৃষ্টি করেছি মিশ্র শুক্রবিন্দু থেকে, এভাবে যে, তাকে পরীক্ষা করব অতঃপর তাকে করে দিয়েছি শ্রবণ ও দৃষ্টিশক্তিসম্পন্ন।
null.verse 76:3: আমি তাকে পথ দেখিয়ে দিয়েছি। এখন সে হয় কৃতজ্ঞ হয়, না হয় অকৃতজ্ঞ হয়।
null.verse 76:4: আমি অবিশ্বাসীদের জন্যে প্রস্তুত রেখেছি শিকল, বেড়ি ও প্রজ্বলিত অগ্নি।
null.verse 76:5: নিশ্চয়ই সৎকর্মশীলরা পান করবে কাফুর মিশ্রিত পানপাত্র।
null.verse 76:6: এটা একটা ঝরণা, যা থেকে আল্লাহর বান্দাগণ পান করবে-তারা একে প্রবাহিত করবে।
null.verse 76:7: তারা মান্নত পূর্ণ করে এবং সেদিনকে ভয় করে, যেদিনের অনিষ্ট হবে সুদূরপ্রসারী।
null.verse 76:8: তারা আল্লাহর প্রেমে অভাবগ্রস্ত, এতীম ও বন্দীকে আহার্য দান করে।
null.verse 76:9: তারা বলেঃ কেবল আল্লাহর সন্তুষ্টির জন্যে আমরা তোমাদেরকে আহার্য দান করি এবং তোমাদের কাছে কোন প্রতিদান ও কৃতজ্ঞতা কামনা করি না।
null.verse 76:10: আমরা আমাদের পালনকর্তার তরফ থেকে এক ভীতিপ্রদ ভয়ংকর দিনের ভয় রাখি।
null.verse 76:11: অতঃপর আল্লাহ তাদেরকে সেদিনের অনিষ্ট থেকে রক্ষা করবেন এবং তাদেরকে দিবেন সজীবতা ও আনন্দ।
null.verse 76:12: এবং তাদের সবরের প্রতিদানে তাদেরকে দিবেন জান্নাত ও রেশমী পোশাক।
null.verse 76:13: তারা সেখানে সিংহাসনে হেলান দিয়ে বসবে। সেখানে রৌদ্র ও শৈত্য অনুভব করবে না।
null.verse 76:14: তার বৃক্ষছায়া তাদের উপর ঝুঁকে থাকবে এবং তার ফলসমূহ তাদের আয়ত্তাধীন রাখা হবে।
null.verse 76:15: তাদেরকে পরিবেশন করা হবে রূপার পাত্রে এবং স্ফটিকের মত পানপাত্রে।
null.verse 76:16: রূপালী স্ফটিক পাত্রে, পরিবেশনকারীরা তা পরিমাপ করে পূর্ণ করবে।
null.verse 76:17: তাদেরকে সেখানে পান করানো হবে ‘যানজাবীল’ মিশ্রিত পানপাত্র।
null.verse 76:18: এটা জান্নাতস্থিত ‘সালসাবীল’ নামক একটি ঝরণা।
null.verse 76:19: তাদের কাছে ঘোরাফেরা করবে চির কিশোরগণ। আপনি তাদেরকে দেখে মনে করবেন যেন বিক্ষিপ্ত মনি-মুক্তা।
null.verse 76:20: আপনি যখন সেখানে দেখবেন, তখন নেয়ামতরাজি ও বিশাল রাজ্য দেখতে পাবেন।
null.verse 76:21: তাদের আবরণ হবে চিকন সবুজ রেশম ও মোটা সবুজ রেশম এবং তাদেরকে পরিধান করোনো হবে রৌপ্য নির্মিত কংকণ এবং তাদের পালনকর্তা তাদেরকে পান করাবেন ‘শরাবান-তহুরা’।
null.verse 76:22: এটা তোমাদের প্রতিদান। তোমাদের প্রচেষ্টা স্বীকৃতি লাভ করেছে।
null.verse 76:23: আমি আপনার প্রতি পর্যায়ক্রমে কোরআন নাযিল করেছি।
null.verse 76:24: অতএব, আপনি আপনার পালনকর্তার আদেশের জন্যে ধৈর্য্য সহকারে অপেক্ষা করুন এবং ওদের মধ্যকার কোন পাপিষ্ঠ কাফেরের আনুগত্য করবেন না।
null.verse 76:25: এবং সকাল-সন্ধ্যায় আপন পালনকর্তার নাম স্মরণ করুন।
null.verse 76:26: রাত্রির কিছু অংশে তাঁর উদ্দেশে সিজদা করুন এবং রাত্রির দীর্ঘ সময় তাঁর পবিত্রতা বর্ণনা করুন।
null.verse 76:27: নিশ্চয় এরা পার্থিব জীবনকে ভালবাসে এবং এক কঠিন দিবসকে পশ্চাতে ফেলে রাখে।
null.verse 76:28: আমি তাদেরকে সৃষ্টি করেছি এবং মজবুত করেছি তাদের গঠন। আমি যখন ইচ্ছা করব, তখন তাদের পরিবর্তে তাদের অনুরূপ লোক আনব।
null.verse 76:29: এটা উপদেশ, অতএব যার ইচ্ছা হয় সে তার পালনকর্তার পথ অবলম্বন করুক।
null.verse 76:30: আল্লাহর অভিপ্রায় ব্যতিরেকে তোমরা অন্য কোন অভিপ্রায় পোষণ করবে না। আল্লাহ সর্বজ্ঞ প্রজ্ঞাময়।
null.verse 76:31: তিনি যাকে ইচ্ছা তাঁর রহমতে দাখিল করেন। আর যালেমদের জন্যে তো প্রস্তুত রেখেছেন মর্মন্তুদ শাস্তি।

Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:1: Не премина ли човекът през период от време, когато той бе нещо неназовано?
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:2: Сътворихме Ние човека от частица сперма с примеси, за да го изпитаме, и го сторихме чуващ, зрящ.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:3: Ние му показахме пътя - или признателен, или неблагодарник.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:4: Приготвихме Ние за неверниците вериги, окови и пламъци.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:5: Праведниците пият от чаши с добавено питие от Камфор -
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:6: извор, от който пият рабите на Аллах - пускат го в обилие да бликва.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:7: Те изпълняват обета и се страхуват от Деня, злото на който се разпростира.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:8: И дават храна - въпреки че и те я обичат - на нуждаещ се и на сирак, и на пленник:
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:9: Храним ви в името на Аллах. Не искаме от вас нито отплата, нито признателност.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:10: Страхуваме се от [мъчението на] Нашия Господ в Деня свъсен, зловещ.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:11: Но Аллах ще ги предпази от злото на този Ден, и ще им дари сияние и щастие.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:12: И ще ги възнагради - защото бяха търпеливи - с Градина и с коприна,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:13: облегнати там на престоли. Не ще виждат там ни зной, ни мраз.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:14: Близо над тях ще са нейните сенки и ще са сведени плодовете й ниско.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:15: Ще бъдат обслужвани със съдове от сребро и с кристални чаши
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:16: от сребърен кристал. Ще им се отмерва с мярка.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:17: И ще им се дава там да пият от питие, смесено с джинджифил,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:19: и ще ги обикалят вечномлади юноши - когато ги видиш, ще ги помислиш за разпръснати бисери.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:20: Където и да погледнеш там, ще видиш блаженство и огромно владение.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:21: Ще бъдат облечени в зелени одежди от коприна и брокат, и ще носят украшения - гривни от сребро, и ще им дава техният Господ да пият от чиста напитка.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:22: Това е награда за вас. Вашето старание заслужи признание.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:24: Затова и ти [о, Мухаммад] бъди търпелив към повелята на твоя Господ, и не се покорявай на никой грешник от тях, или на неверник!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:25: И споменавай името на своя Господ и сутрин, и вечер,
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:26: и в част от нощта Му се покланяй, и дълго нощем Го прославяй!
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:27: Тези обичат преходността и нехаят за тежкия Ден пред тях.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:28: Ние ги сътворихме и укрепихме телата им, а ако пожелаем, напълно ще ги заменим с подобни на тях.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:29: Това е поучение. Който желае, поема пътя към своя Господ.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:30: Тогава ще пожелавате само онова, което Аллах желае. Аллах е всезнаещ, премъдър.
Tzvetan Theophanov.verse 76:31: Той въвежда когото пожелае в Своята милост, а за угнетителите е приготвил болезнено мъчение.

null.verse 76:1: 人確實經歷一個時期，不是一件可以記念的事物。
null.verse 76:2: 我確已用混合的精液創造人，並加以試驗，將他創造成聰明的。
null.verse 76:3: 我確已指引他正道，他或是感謝，或是辜負。
null.verse 76:4: 我確已為不信者預備許多鐵鏈、鐵圈和火獄。
null.verse 76:5: 善人們必得飲含有樟腦的醴泉，
null.verse 76:6: 即真主的眾僕所飲的一道泉水，他們將使它大量涌出。
null.verse 76:7: 他們履行誓願，並畏懼災難普降日。
null.verse 76:8: 他們為喜愛真主而賑濟貧民、孤兒、俘虜。
null.verse 76:9: 「我們只為愛戴真主而賑濟你們，我們不望你們的報酬和感謝。
null.verse 76:10: 我們的確畏懼從我們的主發出的嚴酷的一日。」
null.verse 76:11: 故真主將為他們防禦那日的災難，並賞賜他們光華和快樂。
null.verse 76:12: 他將因他們的堅忍而以樂園和絲綢報酬他們。
null.verse 76:13: 他們在樂園中，靠在床上，不覺炎熱，也不覺嚴寒。
null.verse 76:14: 樂園的蔭影覆庇著他們，樂園的果實，他們容易採摘。
null.verse 76:15: 將有人在他們之間傳遞銀盤和玻璃杯——
null.verse 76:16: 晶瑩如玻璃的銀杯，他們預定每杯的容量。
null.verse 76:17: 他們得用那些杯飲含有薑汁的醴泉，
null.verse 76:18: 即樂園中有名的清快泉。
null.verse 76:19: 許多長生不老的少年，輪流著服侍他們。當你看見那些少年的時候，你以為他們是些散漫的珍珠。
null.verse 76:20: 當你觀看那裡的時候，你會看見恩澤和大國。
null.verse 76:21: 他們將穿著綾羅錦緞的綠袍，他們將享受銀鐲的裝飾，他們的主，將以純潔的飲料賞賜他們。
null.verse 76:22: （將對他們說：）「這確是你們的報酬，你們的勞績是有報酬的。」
null.verse 76:23: 我確已將《古蘭經》零星地降示你，
null.verse 76:24: 故你應當忍受你的主的判決。你不要順從他們中任何犯罪的人，或孤恩的人。
null.verse 76:25: 你應當朝夕記念你的主的尊名，
null.verse 76:26: 夜裡，你應當以小部份時間向他叩頭，以大部份時間讚頌他。
null.verse 76:27: 這等人的確愛好現世，而忽視未來的嚴重的一日。
null.verse 76:28: 我創造了他們，並使他們的體格堅實。如果我意欲，我將以像他們一樣的人代替他們。
null.verse 76:29: 這確是教誨，誰願意覺悟，誰可以選擇一條通達他的主的道路。
null.verse 76:30: 除真主意欲外，你們決不意欲。真主是全知的，是至睿的。
null.verse 76:31: 他使他所意欲的人，入在他的慈恩中。至於不義的人們，他已為他們預備了痛苦的刑罰。

null.verse 76:1: Zdaž uběhla nad člověkem chvíle času, kdy nebyl věcí pojmenovanou?
null.verse 76:2: Věru jsme člověka stvořili z kapky semene, ze směsí, zkoušejíce jej. A slyšícím a vidoucím jsme jej učinili
null.verse 76:3: a na správnou cestu - ať vděčný je, či nevděčný - jsme jej uvedli.
null.verse 76:4: Pro nevěřící jsme pak řetězy, okovy a plamen šlehající připravili,
null.verse 76:5: zatímco zbožní popíjet z poháru budou, v němž kafr je přimísen,
null.verse 76:6: z pramene, z něhož služebníci Boží pijí jen, a v hojnosti tryskajícím ven.
null.verse 76:7: A oni důsledně své přísliby plnili a obávali se dne, jehož zlo se rozletí široce,
null.verse 76:8: a krmili jídlem přes lásku svou k němu chuďasa, sirotka i zajatce.
null.verse 76:9: My krmíme vás z lásky k Bohu a nechceme od vás ani odměny, ani díku velkého,
null.verse 76:10: my obáváme se od Pána svého dne mračného, pohrom plného."
null.verse 76:11: Avšak Bůh je ochránil přede zlem dne toho a zahrnul je jasem a radostí
null.verse 76:12: a odměnil je za to, co vytrpěli, zahradou rajskou a oděvy z hedvábí;
null.verse 76:13: tam na poduškách odpočívat budou a nespatří tam ani slunce žár, ani mráz spalující
null.verse 76:14: a blízko nad nimi budou stromů stíny a nízko budou se sklánět plody visící
null.verse 76:15: a mezi nimi kolovat budou nádoby stříbrné a poháry křišťálové
null.verse 76:16: z křišťálu stříbrného, mírou vhodnou naplněné.
null.verse 76:17: Napájeni budou z číší, v nichž zázvor je přimíchán,
null.verse 76:18: z pramene rajského, jenž Salsabíl je nazýván.
null.verse 76:19: Mezi nimi obcházet budou chlapci mládí věčného; při pohledu na ně bys myslil, že jsou to perly rozsypané.
null.verse 76:20: A když tam pohlédneš, uzříš slasti rozličné a panství rozlehlé.
null.verse 76:21: Oděni budou do šatů z atlasu zeleného a z brokátu a ozdobeni budou náramky stříbrnými a Pán jejich napájet je bude nápojem čirým.
null.verse 76:22: Toto vše věru je vám dáno za odměnu a z vděčnosti za vaše úsilí.
null.verse 76:23: Zajisté jsme ti seslali Korán sesláním;
null.verse 76:24: vytrvej tedy do rozsudku Pána svého a neposlouchej mezi nimi toho, kdo hříšníkem je či nevěřícím!
null.verse 76:25: Jména Pána svého za jitra a za večera vzpomínej,
null.verse 76:26: i v části noci! A před Ním na zem padej a za noci dlouho Jeho slávu pěj!
null.verse 76:27: Ti, kdož milují tento svět pomíjivý, nedbají na den obtížný, jejž mají před sebou.
null.verse 76:28: My jsme je stvořili a jejich údy posílili; a kdybychom chtěli, vystřídali bychom vás vám podobnými snadnou výměnou.
null.verse 76:29: Toto je věru připomenutí; a kdo si přeje, ať k Pánu svému cestu nastoupí,
null.verse 76:30: však přát si toho nebudete, pokud Bůh tak nebude chtíti. A Bůh věru je vševědoucí, moudrý,
null.verse 76:31: koho chce, do milosti Své uvádí, zatímco pro nespravedlivé trest připravil bolestný!

null.verse 76:1: Voorzeker, er is voor de mens een tijdperk geweest toen hij geen vermeldenswaardig ding was.
null.verse 76:2: Wij hebben de mens uit een gemengde levenskiem geschapen en hebben hem horende en ziende gemaakt om hem op de proef te stellen.
null.verse 76:3: Wij hebben hem de weg getoond, hij moge dankbaar of wel ondankbaar zijn.
null.verse 76:4: Voorwaar, Wij hebben voor de ongelovigen ketenen, ijzeren halsbanden en een laaiend Vuur bereid.
null.verse 76:5: Maar de deugdzamen drinken uit een beker (een drank) gemengd met Kamfer.
null.verse 76:6: De dienaren van God drinken uit een bron, welke zij in overvloed doen stromen.
null.verse 76:7: Zij vervullen de gelofte, en vrezen een Dag waarvan het kwaad verstrekkend is.
null.verse 76:8: En zij geven voedsel, uit liefde voor Hem, aan de armen, de wees en de gevangenen.
null.verse 76:9: (Zeggende): "Wij voeden u slechts ter wille van God. Wij verlangen geen beloning noch dank van u.
null.verse 76:10: Wij vrezen van onze Heer een moeilijke en drukkende Dag."
null.verse 76:11: Daarom zal God hen voor het kwade van die Dag beschermen en zal hun blijdschap en geluk schenken.
null.verse 76:12: En Hij zal hen voor hun standvastigheid belonen met een tuin en kleren van zijde.
null.verse 76:13: Zich daarin nedervlijende op sofa’s zullen zij het noch te koud noch te warm hebben.
null.verse 76:14: En de schaduw der bomen zal dicht over hen zijn en de trossen fruit zullen gemakkelijk bereikbaar worden gemaakt.
null.verse 76:15: En zilveren vaten zullen aan hen worden rondgereikt, en bekers
null.verse 76:16: Kristalhelder, uit zilver, in de juiste maat vervaardigd.
null.verse 76:17: En daarin zal hun een drank worden gegeven, vermengd met Gember.
null.verse 76:18: Van een bron genaamd: Salsabiel.
null.verse 76:19: En jonge mensen, die niet verouderen, zullen om hen rondgaan (om hen te bedienen). Wanneer gij hen ziet, denkt gij dat zij verstrooide paarlen zijn.
null.verse 76:20: En waarheen gij ook kijkt, zult gij een zaligheid voelen en een groot koninkrijk aanschouwen.
null.verse 76:21: Zij zullen klederen van fijne groene zijde en zwaar brocaat dragen en zilveren armbanden. En hun Heer zal hun een zuivere drank geven.
null.verse 76:22: (Hij zal zeggen): "Dit is uw loon, omdat uw streven waardevol was."
null.verse 76:23: Voorwaar, Wij hebben de Koran aan u bij gedeelten geopenbaard.
null.verse 76:24: Wees daarom geduldig volgens het gebod van uw Heer en gehoorzaam niemand die onder hen zondig of ongelovig is.
null.verse 76:25: En gedenk de naam van uw Heer ’s morgens en ’s avonds.
null.verse 76:26: En aanbid Hem gedurende (een deel) van de nacht en prijs Zijn eer gedurende een groot deel ervan.
null.verse 76:27: Waarlijk, de ongelovigen houden van de voorbijgaande wereld en denken niet aan de zware Dag (des Oordeels).
null.verse 76:28: Wij zijn het Die hen geschapen hebben en hun lichaamsbouw hebben gesterkt. En indien Wij willen, kunnen Wij hen door gelijksoortige schepselen vervangen.
null.verse 76:29: Voorwaar, dit is een vermaning. Wie het daarom wenst, kieze een weg die tot zijn Heer leidt.
null.verse 76:30: En gij zult niets anders willen dan hetgeen God wil. Voorwaar, God is Alwetend, Alwijs.
null.verse 76:31: Hij laat tot Zijn barmhartigheid ingaan wie Hij wil, en voor de onrechtvaardigen heeft Hij een pijnlijke straf bereid.

Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:1: Hath there come upon man (ever) any period of time in which he was a thing unremembered ?
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:2: Lo! We create man from a drop of thickened fluid to test him; so We make him hearing, knowing.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:3: Lo! We have shown him the way, whether he be grateful or disbelieving.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:4: Lo! We have prepared for disbelievers manacles and carcans and a raging fire.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:5: Lo! the righteous shall drink of a cup whereof the mixture is of Kafur,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:6: A spring wherefrom the slaves of Allah drink, making it gush forth abundantly,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:7: (Because) they perform the vow and fear a day whereof the evil is wide-spreading,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:8: And feed with food the needy wretch, the orphan and the prisoner, for love of Him,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:9: (Saying): We feed you, for the sake of Allah only. We wish for no reward nor thanks from you;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:10: Lo! we fear from our Lord a day of frowning and of fate.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:11: Therefor Allah hath warded off from them the evil of that day, and hath made them find brightness and joy;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:12: And hath awarded them for all that they endured, a Garden and silk attire;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:13: Reclining therein upon couches, they will find there neither (heat of) a sun nor bitter cold.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:14: The shade thereof is close upon them and the clustered fruits thereof bow down.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:15: Goblets of silver are brought round for them, and beakers (as) of glass
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:16: (Bright as) glass but (made) of silver, which they (themselves) have measured to the measure (of their deeds).
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:17: There are they watered with a cup whereof the mixture is of Zanjabil,
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:18: (The water of) a spring therein, named Salsabil.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:19: There wait on them immortal youths, whom, when thou seest, thou wouldst take for scattered pearls.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:20: When thou seest, thou wilt see there bliss and high estate.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:21: Their raiment will be fine green silk and gold embroidery. Bracelets of silver will they wear. Their Lord will slake their thirst with a pure drink.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:22: (And it will be said unto them): Lo! this is a reward for you. Your endeavour (upon earth) hath found acceptance.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:23: Lo! We, even We, have revealed unto thee the Qur’an, a revelation;
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:24: So submit patiently to thy Lord’s command, and obey not of them any guilty one or disbeliever.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:25: Remember the name of thy Lord at morn and evening.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:26: And worship Him (a portion) of the night. And glorify Him through the livelong night.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:27: Lo! these love fleeting life, and put behind them (the remembrance of) a grievous day.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:28: We, even We, created them, and strengthened their frame. And when We will, We can replace them, bringing others like them in their stead.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:29: Lo! this is an Admonishment, that whosoever will may choose a way unto his Lord.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:30: Yet ye will not, unless Allah willeth. Lo! Allah is Knower, Wise.
Marmaduke Pickthall.verse 76:31: He maketh whom He will to enter His mercy, and for evil-doers hath prepared a painful doom.

Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:1: Has there not been over Man a long period of Time, when he was nothing - (not even) mentioned?
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:2: Verily We created Man from a drop of mingled sperm, in order to try him: So We gave him (the gifts), of Hearing and Sight.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:3: We showed him the Way: whether he be grateful or ungrateful (rests on his will).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:4: For the Rejecters we have prepared chains, yokes, and a blazing Fire.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:5: As to the Righteous, they shall drink of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Kafur,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:6: A Fountain where the Devotees of God do drink, making it flow in unstinted abundance.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:7: They perform (their) vows, and they fear a Day whose evil flies far and wide.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:8: And they feed, for the love of God, the indigent, the orphan, and the captive,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:9: (Saying),"We feed you for the sake of God alone: no reward do we desire from you, nor thanks.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:10: "We only fear a Day of distressful Wrath from the side of our Lord."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:11: But God will deliver them from the evil of that Day, and will shed over them a Light of Beauty and (blissful) Joy.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:12: And because they were patient and constant, He will reward them with a Garden and (garments of) silk.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:13: Reclining in the (Garden) on raised thrones, they will see there neither the sun’s (excessive heat) nor (the moon’s) excessive cold.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:14: And the shades of the (Garden) will come low over them, and the bunches (of fruit), there, will hang low in humility.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:15: And amongst them will be passed round vessels of silver and goblets of crystal,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:16: Crystal-clear, made of silver: they will determine the measure thereof (according to their wishes).
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:17: And they will be given to drink there of a Cup (of Wine) mixed with Zanjabil,-
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:19: And round about them will (serve) youths of perpetual (freshness): If thou seest them, thou wouldst think them scattered Pearls.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:20: And when thou lookest, it is there thou wilt see a Bliss and a Realm Magnificent.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:21: Upon them will be green Garments of fine silk and heavy brocade, and they will be adorned with Bracelets of silver; and their Lord will give to them to drink of a Wine Pure and Holy.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:22: "Verily this is a Reward for you, and your Endeavour is accepted and recognised."
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:23: It is We Who have sent down the Qur’an to thee by stages.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:24: Therefore be patient with constancy to the Command of thy Lord, and hearken not to the sinner or the ingrate among them.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:25: And celebrate the name or thy Lord morning and evening,
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:26: And part of the night, prostrate thyself to Him; and glorify Him a long night through.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:27: As to these, they love the fleeting life, and put away behind them a Day (that will be) hard.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:28: It is We Who created them, and We have made their joints strong; but, when We will, We can substitute the like of them by a complete change.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:29: This is an admonition: Whosoever will, let him take a (straight) Path to his Lord.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:30: But ye will not, except as God wills; for God is full of Knowledge and Wisdom.
Abdullah Yusuf Ali.verse 76:31: He will admit to His Mercy whom He will; But the wrong-doers,- for them has He prepared a grievous Penalty.

Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:1: Has there come on man a while of time when he was a thing unremembered?
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:2: We created man of a sperm-drop, a mingling, and We made him hearing, seeing.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:3: Surely We guided him upon the way whether he be thankful or unthankful.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:4: Surely We have prepared for the unbelievers chains, fetters, and a Blaze.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:5: Surely the pious shall drink of a cup whose mixture is camphor,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:6: a fountain whereat drink the servants of God, making it to gush forth plenteously.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:7: They fulfil their vows, and fear a day whose evil is upon the wing;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:8: they give food, for the love of Him, to the needy, the orphan, the captive:
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:9: ’We feed you only for the Face of God; we desire no recompense from you, no thankfulness;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:10: for we fear from our Lord a frowning day, inauspicious.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:11: So God has guarded them from the evil of that day, and has procured them radiancy and gladness,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:12: and recompensed them for their patience with a Garden, and silk;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:13: therein they shall recline upon couches, therein they shall see neither sun nor bitter cold;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:14: near them shall be its shades, and its clusters hung meekly down,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:15: and there shall be passed around them vessels of silver, and goblets of crystal,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:16: crystal of silver that they have measured -- very exactly.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:17: And therein they shall be given to drink a cup whose mixture is ginger,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:18: therein a fountain whose name is called Salsabil.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:19: Immortal youths shall go about them; when thou seest them, thou supposest them scattered pearls,
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:20: when thou seest them then thou seest bliss and a great kingdom.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:21: Upon them shall be green garments of silk and brocade; they are adorned with bracelets of silver, and their Lord shall give them to drink a pure draught.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:22: Behold, this is a recompense for you, and your striving is thanked.’
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:23: Surely We have sent down the Koran on thee, a sending down;
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:24: so be thou patient under the judgment of thy Lord, and obey not one of them, sinner or unbeliever.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:25: And remember the Name of thy Lord at dawn and in the evening
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:26: and part of the night; bow down before Him and magnify Him through the long night.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:27: Surely these men love the hasty world, and leave be behind them a heavy day.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:28: We created them, and We strengthened their joints; and, when We will, We shall exchange their likes.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:29: Surely this is a Reminder; so he who will, takes unto his Lord a way.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:30: But you will not unless God wills; surely God is ever All-knowing, All-wise.
Arthur J. Arberry.verse 76:31: For He admits into His mercy whomsoever He will; as for the evildoers, He has prepared for them a painful chastisement.

Muhammad Asad.verse 76:1: HAS THERE [not] been an endless span of time before man [appeared – a time] when he was not yet a thing to be thought of?
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:2: Verily, it is We who have created man out of a drop of sperm intermingled, so that We might try him [in his later life]: and therefore We made him a being endowed with hearing and sight.
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:3: Verily, We have shown him the way: [and it rests with him to prove himself] either grateful or ungrateful.
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:4: [Now,] behold, for those who deny the truth We have readied chains and shackles, and a blazing flame
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:5: [whereas,] behold, the truly virtuous shall drink from a cup flavoured with the calyx of sweet-smelling flowers:
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:6: a source [of bliss] whereof God’s servants shall drink, seeing it flow in a flow abundant.
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:7: [The truly virtuous are] they [who] fulfil their vows, and stand in awe of a Day the woe of which is bound to spread far and wide,
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:8: and who give food – however great be their own want of it – unto the needy, and the orphan, and the captive,
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:9: [saying, in their hearts,] "We feed you for the sake of God alone: we desire no recompense from you, nor thanks:
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:10: behold, we stand in awe of our Sustainer’s judgment on a distressful, fateful Day!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:11: And so, God will preserve them from the woes of that Day, and will bestow on them brightness and joy,
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:12: and will reward them for all their patience in adversity with a garden [of bliss] and with [garments of] silk.
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:13: In that [garden] they will on couches recline, and will know therein neither [burning] sun nor cold severe,
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:14: since its [blissful] shades will come down low over them, and low will hang down its clusters of fruit, most easy to reach.
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:15: And they will be waited upon with vessels of silver and goblets that will [seem to] be crystal
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:16: crystal-like, [but] of silver – the measure whereof they alone will determine.
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:17: And in that [paradise] they will be given to drink of a cup flavoured with ginger,
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:18: [derived from] a source [to be found] therein, whose name is "Seek Thy Way."
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:19: And immortal youths will wait upon them: when thou seest them, thou wouldst deem them to be scattered pearls;
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:20: and when thou seest [anything that is] there, thou wilt see [only] bliss and a realm transcendent.
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:21: Upon those [blest] will be garments of green silk and brocade; and they will be adorned with bracelets of silver. And their Sustainer will give them to drink of a drink most pure.
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:22: [And they will be told:] "Verily, all this is your reward, since your endeavour [in life] has met with [God’s] goodly acceptance!"
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:23: VERILY, [O believer,] it is We who have bestowed from on high this Qur’ān upon thee, step by step – truly a bestowal from on high!
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:24: Await, then, in all patience thy Sustainer’s judgment, and pay no heed to any of them who is a willful sinner or an ingrate;
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:25: and bear in mind thy Sustainer’s name at morn and evening
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:26: and during some of the night, and prostrate thyself before Him, and extol His limitless glory throughout the long night.
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:27: Behold, they [who are unmindful of God] love this fleeting life, and leave behind them [all thought of] a grief-laden Day.
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:28: [They will not admit to themselves that] it is We who have created them and strengthened their make – and [that], if it be Our will, We can replace them entirely with others of their kind.
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:29: VERILY, all this is an admonition: whoever, then, so wills, may unto his Sustainer find a way.
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:30: But you cannot will it unless God wills [to show you that way]: for, behold, God is indeed all-knowing, wise.
Muhammad Asad.verse 76:31: He admits unto His grace everyone who wills [to be admitted]; but as for the evildoers – for them has He readied grievous suffering [in the life to come].

Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:1: There has come upon man a period of time in which he was nothing worth mentioning.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:2: We have created man from a mixed sperm-drop to put him to a test; then We made him able to hear, able to see.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:3: We have shown him the way to be either grateful or ungrateful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:4: We have prepared, for the disbelievers, shackles and iron-collars and a blazing Fire.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:5: Indeed, the righteous will have a drink from a goblet, blended with (a drink from) Camphor
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:6: that will be a spring from which Allah’s servants will drink, making it flow (wherever they wish) profusely.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:7: They (are the ones who) fulfill their vows, and fear a day whose evil (events) will spread far and wide,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:8: and they give food, out of their love for Him (Allah), to the needy, and the orphan, and the captive,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:9: (saying to them,) “We feed you only for the sake of Allah; we have no intention of (receiving) either a return from you or thanks.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:10: In fact, we are fearful of a day, from the side of our Lord, that will be frowning, extremely malignant.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:11: So Allah will save them from the evil of that day, and will grant them bloom and delight,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:12: and will give them, in return for their patience, Paradise and (garments of) silk,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:13: wherein they will be reclining on couches, feeling neither heat of the sun nor intense cold.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:14: And shades of gardens will be hanging low on them, and their fruits will be placed totally under their command.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:15: Circulated among them will be vessels of silver, and cups that will be (as transparent as) crystals,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:16: -crystals (as shining as if made) of silver, measured by those (who filled them) with due measure.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:17: And they will be served with goblet of a drink blended with ginger,
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:18: (acquired from) a spring therein called Salsabīl.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:19: And circling around them will be serving boys, blessed with eternal youth; when you would see them, you would take them as scattered pearls.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:20: When you will look around there, you will see the Bliss and a magnificent realm.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:21: Upon them will be garments of green sundus (a kind of fine silk), and of istabraq (a kind of thick silk), and they will be adorned by bracelets of silver. Their Lord will give them a pure beverage to drink:
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:22: “This is a reward for you, and your effort has been appreciated.”
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:23: Indeed we have revealed to you the Qur’ān through a gradual process.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:24: So, be steadfast patiently in (obeying) your Lord’s command, and do not obey any one of them who is sinner or ungrateful.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:25: And pronounce the name of Allah morning and evening.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:26: And in some parts of night prostrate yourself before Him, and pronounce His purity for long times at night.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:27: In fact these people love that which is immediate, and neglect a Heavy Day ahead of them.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:28: We have created them and have made their joints strong. And whenever We will, We would replace them with others like them, a total replacement.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:29: Indeed, this is a reminder; so let anyone who so wishes, adopt a way to his Lord.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:30: And you will not so wish unless Allah so wills. Indeed Allah is All-Knowing, All-Wise.
Mufti Muhammad Taqi Uthmani.verse 76:31: He admits whomsoever He wills to His mercy. As for the wrongdoers, He has prepared for them a painful punishment.

Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:1: Has there [ever] been for man a period of time in which he was a thing unmentioned?
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:2: Verily We created man from a drop of mixed fluid, so that We may test him. So We made him hearing, seeing.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:3: Verily We have guided him to the way, whether he be grateful or ungrateful.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:4: We have assuredly prepared for the disbelievers chains, and fetters, and a hell-fire.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:5: Truly the righteous will drink from a cup whose mixture is camphor;
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:6: a spring from which the servants of God drink, making it gush forth plenteously.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:7: They fulfil their vows and fear a day the evil of which will be widespread.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:8: And they give food, despite [their] love of it to the needy, and the orphan, and the prisoner.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:9: ‘We feed you only for the sake of God. We do not desire any reward from you, nor any thanks.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:10: Indeed we fear from our Lord a day of frowning, calamitous’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:11: God has therefore shielded them from the evil of that day, and has granted them radiancy and joy.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:12: And He has rewarded them for their patience with a Garden and silk,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:13: reclining therein upon couches. They will not find therein either sun or bitter cold.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:14: And close over them will be its shades and its clusters [of fruits] will hang low.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:15: And they will be waited upon from all around them with vessels of silver, and goblets of crystal —
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:16: crystal of silver, which they have measured in a precise measure.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:17: And they will be given to drink therein a cup whose mixture is ginger,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:19: And they will be waited upon by immortal youths, whom, when you see them you will suppose them to be scattered pearls.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:20: And when you look there, you will see bliss and a great kingdom.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:21: Upon them will be garments of fine green silk and [heavy] silk brocade. And they will be adorned with bracelets of silver and their Lord will give them a pure drink to drink.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:22: ‘Verily this is a reward for you, and your endeavour has been appreciated’.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:23: Assuredly We have revealed the Qur’ān to you as a gradual revelation.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:24: So submit patiently to your Lord’s decree, and do not obey of them any sinner or disbeliever.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:25: And mention the Name of your Lord at dawn and with the declining of the sun,
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:26: and prostrate to Him for a portion of the night, and glorify Him the length of the night.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:27: Assuredly these love the transitory [life] and leave behind them a burdensome day.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:28: We created them and made firm their frames, and, whenever We will, We can completely replace them with others like them.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:29: This is indeed a reminder. Let him who will, then, choose a way to his Lord.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:30: But you will not, unless God wills. Assuredly God is ever Knower, Wise.
Royal Aal al-Bayt Institute Translation.verse 76:31: He admits whomever He will into His mercy, and as for the evildoers, He has prepared for them a painful chastisement.

Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:1: Surely, there has passed over man a period of time when he was not a thing worth mentioning.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:2: Surely, We created man from a fertilized ovum that We keep turning and examining (from one stage to the next till birth). So We have made him (in the order of) hearing (then) seeing.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:3: Indeed, We also showed him the way (to understanding and insight for distinguishing between the truth and falsehood) whether he (now) becomes thankful or continues to be ungrateful.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:4: Verily, We have prepared for the disbelievers chains (for the feet), neck-fetters and the Blazing Fire (of Hell).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:5: Surely, the sincerely devoted and obedient will drink from the cups (of the holy drink) mixed with kafur (to enhance its aroma, colour and taste).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:6: (Kafur is) a spring (in Paradise) that (the privileged) servants of Allah (i.e., Awliya’ Allah) will drink from, and will (also) make it flow to wherever they will desire in the form of small brooks (to make others drink of it).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:7: (These privileged servants of Allah are those) who fulfil their vows and keep fearing that Day whose severity spreads afar.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:8: And they give (their own) food, in deep love of Allah, to the needy, the orphan and prisoner (out of sacrifice, despite their own desire and need for it),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:9: (And say:) ‘We are feeding you only to please Allah. We do not seek any recompense from you nor (wish for) any thanks.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:10: We fear from our Lord the Day which will make (the faces) look very dark (and) ugly.’
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:11: So Allah will save them from the terror of that Day (for their fear of Allah) and will grant them freshness, bloom and blush (on their faces) and ecstasy and delight (in their hearts),
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:12: And will bless them with Gardens (to live in) and silky clothes (to wear), a reward for their patience.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:13: Reclining in it against cushions on raised couches, they will find there neither intense cold nor heat.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:14: And the shades (of trees in Paradise) will close upon them, and the bunches of their (fruits) will be hanging low.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:15: And (the servants) will go round them with vessels of silver and (pure and clean) goblets of shining glass,
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:16: And glasses made of silver which they will have filled with exact measures (according to everyone’s desire).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:17: And they will be made to drink there cups of (the holy drink) mixed with Zanjabil.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:18: (Zanjabil is) a spring in this (Paradise) named Salsabil.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:19: And going round them will be (innocent) adolescents who will remain ever-young. When you will see them, you will consider them as scattered pearls.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:20: And when you will look (at Paradise), you will find blessings (in abundance) and a mighty kingdom (all around).
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:21: They will be clad in green, fine silk and rich brocade attire, and they will be made to wear silver bracelets, and their Lord will make them drink a holy beverage.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:22: Surely, that will be your reward and your hard work is acknowledged.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:23: Indeed, We have revealed the Qur’an to you piecemeal.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:24: So (continue to) be patient for the sake of your Lord’s command and do not give your ear to any liar, sinner or disbeliever or thankless person from amongst them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:25: And remember the Name of your Lord morning and evening.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:26: And prostrate yourself before His presence for some hours of the night, and glorify Him during (the rest of) the long hours of the night.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:27: Surely, these (world-mongers) love the gains that are achievable right away. And they have put behind their backs (the remembrance of) the very hard Day.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:28: (They do not realize that) We alone have created them and have made their every joint strong, and We can replace them whenever We may please with the people like them.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:29: Indeed, this (Qur’an) is a Reminder. So whoever desires may adopt the way to (reach) his Lord.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:30: And you cannot wish anything yourselves except what Allah wills. Indeed, Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise.
Recitations of Ibrahim walk from saheeh.verse 76:31: He admits whom He wills to (the circle of) His mercy, and He has prepared a grievous torment for the wrongdoers.

null.verse 76:1: Eikö ole kulunut pitkä aika, ennenkuin ihmisestä tuli jotakin mainitsemisen arvoista?
null.verse 76:2: Me olemme totisesti luonut ihmisen siemenestä yhdistäen sen toiseen. Me aiomme kasvattaa häntä, ja niin olemme antanut hänelle kuulon ja näön.
null.verse 76:3: Totisesti olemme ohjannut hänet polulle, olkoonpa hän kiitollinen tai kiittämätön.
null.verse 76:4: Totisesti olemme valmistanut uskottomille kahleet ja ketjut sekä helvetin tulen.
null.verse 76:5: Totisesti saavat hurskaat juoda maljasta, johon on kätketty heidän (sisäinen) vapautuksensa,
null.verse 76:6: lähteestä, josta Jumalan palvelijat juovat runsain määrin.
null.verse 76:7: He täyttävät lupauksensa ja pelkäävät päivää, jonka tuho leviää ylt'ympäri;
null.verse 76:8: rakkaudesta Häneen he ruokkivat köyhää, orpoa ja vangittua.
null.verse 76:9: »Me ruokimme teitä vain Jumalan tähden; me emme vaadi teiltä palkkaa emmekä kiitosta,
null.verse 76:10: totisesti pelkäämme surun ja murheen päivää, jonka Herramme lähettää.»
null.verse 76:11: Siksi Jumala säästää heidät tuon päivän tuholta ja antaa heidän osakseen iloa ja onnea;
null.verse 76:12: Hän palkitsee heitä heidän lujuutensa tähden paratiisilla ja silkkivaatteilla.
null.verse 76:13: Näihin puettuina ja leväten nojakorokkeilla he eivät tunne hellettä eivätkä purevaa kylmää,
null.verse 76:14: vaan puutarhan varjot lepäävät tiheinä heidän yllään, ja sen hedelmät ovat käden ulottuvilla.
null.verse 76:15: Siellä kiertävät hopeamaljat ja kristallipikarit,
null.verse 76:16: jotka ovat kuin läpikuultava lasi ja jotka täytetään runsain mitoin.
null.verse 76:17: He saavat juoda inkiväärillä höystetyn maljan
null.verse 76:18: lähteestä, jota siellä kutsutaan Salsabiliksi.
null.verse 76:19: Ja heidän ympärillään liikkuvat ikinuoret olennot, joita nähdessäsi sinusta tuntuu, kuin he olisivat ylt'ympäri siroiteltuja helmiä.
null.verse 76:20: Ja kun saat nähdä sen, olet näkevä autuuden ja suuren kuningaskunnan.
null.verse 76:21: Heidän vaatetuksenaan on viheriä, hieno silkki ja paksu, kultakudoksinen sametti. He saavat kantaa hopeaisia rannerenkaita, ja heidän Herransa virvoittaa heitä puhtaalla juomalla.
null.verse 76:22: Tämä on totisesti oleva palkkanne, sillä ponnistelunne palkitaan.
null.verse 76:23: Totisesti olemme lähettänyt sinulle tämän Koraanin vähitellen useina ilmoituksina.
null.verse 76:24: Pysy siis lujana odottaen kärsivällisesti Herrasi tuomiota äläkä tottele ketään syntistä tai kiittämätöntä heidän joukostaan.
null.verse 76:25: Ylistä Herrasi nimeä aamuin ja illoin!
null.verse 76:26: Polvistu yön aikana Häntä palvomaan ja ylistä Häntä myöhään yöhön!
null.verse 76:27: Totisesti muut ihmiset rakastavat tätä maallista elämää eivätkä pidä lukua turmion päivästä.
null.verse 76:28: Me olemme luonut heidät ja vahvistanut heidän jäsenensä, ja jos tahdomme, voimme heidän sijaansa aikaansaada täysin heidän kaltaisiaan olentoja.
null.verse 76:29: Totisesti tämä on kehoitus, ja se, joka tahtoo, löytää tien Herransa luokse.
null.verse 76:30: Mutta teitä se ei miellytä, ellei Jumala kuitenkin niin määrää; totisesti, Jumalan on tieto, viisaus.
null.verse 76:31: Hän sulkee armoonsa kenet haluaa, mutta jumalattomille Hän on varannut tuskan ja kurituksen.

Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:1: Ne s'est-il pas écoulé pour l'homme un laps de temps durant lequel il n'était pas fait mention de lui [parmi les choses existantes] ?
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:2: Certes, Nous avons créé l'homme, pour l'éprouver, à partir d'un fluide composite, et Nous lui avons donné l'ouïe et la vue.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:3: Nous l'avons guidé sur le bon chemin, qu'il soit reconnaissant, ou qu'il soit ingrat.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:4: Certes, Nous avons préparé pour les mécréants des chaînes, des carcans et un brasier.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:5: Les hommes purs boiront à une coupe dont le mélange sera de camphre,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:6: venant d'une source à laquelle les serviteurs de Dieu boiront tout en la faisant jaillir en abondance.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:7: Ceux-là accomplissaient fidèlement leurs vœux et redoutaient un Jour dont le mal se répandrait partout.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:8: Ils nourrissaient le pauvre, l'orphelin et le captif, pour l'amour de Dieu, [disant :]
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:9: " Nous vous nourrissons pour plaire à Dieu, n'attendant de vous ni récompense, ni gratitude.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:10: Oui, nous redoutons de la part de notre Seigneur un Jour menaçant et calamiteux. "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:11: Mais Dieu les a protégés du malheur de ce jour, et Il les a baignés de clarté et de joie.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:12: Il les a récompensés pour leur patience en leur donnant un jardin et des vêtements de soie.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:13: Là, accoudés sur des lits d'apparat, ils n'auront à subir ni soleil ardent, ni froid mordant.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:14: Ses ombrages les couvriront et ses grappes de fruits se pencheront vers eux pour être cueillies.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:15: On fera circuler parmi eux des vaisseaux d'argent et des coupes de cristal,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:16: de cristal argenté qui seront remplies à la juste mesure.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:17: On leur en fera boire un gobelet dont le mélange sera de gingembre,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:18: puisé à une source proche nommée " Salsabîl ".
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:19: Des éphèbes immortels circuleront autour d'eux. Lorsque tu les verras, tu penseras que ce sont des perles détachées,
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:20: et lorsque tu regarderas là-bas, tu verras un délice et un vaste royaume.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:21: Ils porteront des vêtements verts, de satin et de brocart. Ils seront parés de bracelets d'argent. Leur Seigneur les désaltèrera d'une boisson pure :
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:22: " Cela vous est accordé comme une récompense. Votre zèle a été reconnu ! "
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:23: Oui, Nous avons fait descendre sur toi le Coran comme Révélation.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:24: Accepte donc patiemment le décret de ton Seigneur, et n'obéis à aucun d'entre eux qui soit pécheur ingrat ou mécréant invétéré.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:25: Invoque le Nom de ton Seigneur le matin et le soir.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:26: La nuit, prosterne-toi devant Lui et glorifie-Le longuement.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:27: Ces gens aiment la vie éphémère et ils délaissent un Jour grave.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:28: Nous les avons créés et Nous avons fixé solidement leurs jointures. Pourtant, si Nous le voulions, Nous les remplacerions par des êtres semblables à eux.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:29: Ceci est vraiment un Rappel. Que celui qui le veut prenne donc un chemin vers son Seigneur ;
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:30: mais vous ne le voudrez que si Dieu le veut. Dieu, certes, sait tout et Il est sage.
Jean-Louis Michon.verse 76:31: Il fait entrer qui Il veut dans Sa miséricorde. Et pour les iniques, Il a préparé un châtiment douloureux.

Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:1: S’est-il écoulé pour l’homme un laps de temps durant lequel il n’était même pas une chose mentionnable ?
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:2: En effet, Nous avons créé l’homme d’une goutte de sperme mélangé [aux composantes diverses] pour le mettre à l’épreuve. [C’est pourquoi] Nous l’avons fait entendant et voyant.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:3: Nous l’avons guidé dans le chemin, - qu’il soit reconnaissant ou ingrat -
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:4: Nous avons préparé pour les infidèles des chaînes, des carcans et une fournaise ardente.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:5: Les vertueux boiront d’une coupe dont le mélange sera de camphre,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:6: d’une source de laquelle boiront les serviteurs de Dieu et ils la feront jaillir en abondance. .
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:7: Ils accomplissent leurs voeux et ils redoutent un jour dont le mal s’étendra partout.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:8: et offrent la nourriture, malgré son amour , au pauvre, à l’orphelin et au prisonnier,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:9: (disant) : «C’est pour le visage de Dieu que nous vous nourrissons : nous ne voulons de vous ni récompense ni gratitude.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:10: Nous redoutons, de notre Seigneur, un jour terrible et catastrophique».
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:11: Dieu les protégera donc du mal de ce jour-là, et leur fera rencontrer la splendeur et la joie,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:12: et les rétribuera pour ce qu’ils auront enduré, en leur donnant le Paradis et des [vêtements] de soie,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:13: ils y seront accoudés sur des divans, n’y voyant ni soleil ni froid glacial .
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:14: Ses ombrages les couvriront de près, et ses fruits inclinés bien bas [à portée de leurs mains].
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:15: Et l’on fera circuler parmi eux des récipients d’argent et des coupes cristallines,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:16: en cristal d’argent, dont le contenu a été savamment dosé.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:17: Et là, ils seront abreuvés d’une coupe dont le mélange sera de gingembre,
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:18: puisé là-dedans à une source qui s’appelle Salsabil.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:19: Et parmi eux, circuleront des garçons éternellement jeunes. Quand tu les verras, tu les prendras pour des perles éparpillées.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:20: Et quand tu regarderas là-bas, tu verras un délice et un vaste royaume.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:21: Ils porteront des vêtements verts de satin et de brocart. Et ils seront parés de bracelets d’argent. Et leur Seigneur les abreuvera d’une boisson très pure.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:22: Cela sera pour vous une récompense, et votre effort sera reconnu.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:23: En vérité c’est Nous qui avons fait descendre sur toi le Coran graduellement.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:24: Endure donc ce que ton Seigneur a décrété, et n’obéis ni au pécheur, parmi eux, ni au grand mécréant.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:25: Et invoque le nom de ton Seigneur, matin et après-midi;
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:26: et prosterne-toi devant Lui une partie de la nuit; et glorifie Le de longues [heures] pendant la nuit.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:27: Ces gens-là aiment [la vie] éphémère (la vie sur terre) et laissent derrière eux un jour bien lourd [le jour du Jugement].
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:28: C’est Nous qui les avons créés et avons fortifié leur constitution. Quand Nous voulons, cependant, Nous les remplaçons [facilement] par leurs semblables.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:29: Ceci est un rappel. Que celui qui veut prenne donc le chemin vers son Seigneur !
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:30: Cependant, vous ne saurez vouloir, à moins que Dieu veuille. Et Dieu est Omniscient et Sage.
Muhammad Hamidullah.verse 76:31: Il fait entrer qui Il veut dans Sa miséricorde. Et quant aux injustes, Il leur a préparé un châtiment douloureux.

null.verse 76:1: Wahrlich, es kam über den Menschen eine Zeit, da er nichts Nennenswertes war.
null.verse 76:2: Wir erschufen den Menschen aus einem Mischtropfen, auf daß Wir ihn prüfen möchten; dann gaben Wir ihm Gehör und Gesicht.
null.verse 76:3: Wir haben ihm den Weg gezeigt, ob er nun dankbar oder undankbar sei.
null.verse 76:4: Wahrlich, Wir haben für die Ungläubigen Ketten, eiserne Nackenfesseln und ein flammendes Feuer bereitet.
null.verse 76:5: Die Gerechten aber trinken aus einem Becher, dem Kampfer beigemischt ist -
null.verse 76:6: Eine Quelle, von der die Diener Allahs trinken. und die sie hervorsprudeln lassen in reichlichem Sprudel.
null.verse 76:7: Sie vollbringen das Gelübde, und sie fürchten einen Tag, dessen Übel sich weithin ausbreitet.
null.verse 76:8: Und sie geben Speise, aus Liebe zu Ihm, dem Armen, der Waise und dem Gefangenen,
null.verse 76:9: (Indem sie sprechen :) «Wir speisen euch nur um Allahs willen. Wir begehren von euch weder Lohn noch Dank.
null.verse 76:10: Wir fürchten von unserem Herrn einen Tag des Finsterblickens und des Unheils.»
null.verse 76:11: Drum wird Allah sie vor dem Übel jenes Tags bewahren und ihnen Freude und Glück bescheren.
null.verse 76:12: Und Er wird sie für ihre Standhaftigkeit belohnen mit einem Garten und seidnen (Gewändern),
null.verse 76:13: Darin auf erhöhten Sitzen lehnend, werden sie dort weder Gluthitze noch Eiseskälte erfahren.
null.verse 76:14: Und seine Schatten werden dicht über ihnen sein, und seine gebüschelten Früchte werden leicht erreichbar gemacht.
null.verse 76:15: Und Trinkgefäße aus Silber werden unter ihnen kreisen, und Pokale von Glas,
null.verse 76:16: (Durchsichtig wie) Glas, doch aus Silber, und sie werden ihren Umfang bemessen nach dem Maß.
null.verse 76:17: Und es wird ihnen dort ein Becher zu trinken gereicht werden, dem Ingwer beigemischt ist -
null.verse 76:18: Eine Quelle darinnen, Salsabíl geheißen.
null.verse 76:19: Und es werden ihnen dort Jünglinge aufwarten, die kein Alter berührt. Wenn du sie siehst, du hältst sie für Perlen, verstreute;
null.verse 76:20: Und wenn du dort in irgendeine Richtung schauest, so wirst du Glückseligkeit und ein großes Reich erblicken.
